title: Tikona Fort
subtitle: The Triangular Fort of the Sahyadris
overview: Tikona Fort, also known as Vitandgad, is a beautiful hill fort located near Lonavala in Maharashtra. The name 'Tikona' comes from its triangular shape, and it stands as one of the most scenic trekking destinations in the Sahyadri mountain range.

The fort dates back to the 15th century and played a key role in guarding the Maval region. It was later captured by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and served as an important watchtower fort due to its strategic location and commanding views of the surrounding valleys and lakes.

highlights.title: Scenic Trek
highlights.description: A popular short trek with panoramic views of Pawna Lake, Tung Fort, and Lohagad-Vishapur range.

highlights.title: Historical Significance
highlights.description: Once under the control of the Nizam Shahi dynasty and later captured by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

highlights.title: Pawna Lake View
highlights.description: The fort offers mesmerizing views of Pawna Lake and lush green valleys during the monsoon season.

geography.intro: Tikona Fort rises to about 3,500 feet above sea level and is located near Kamshet, close to Lonavala. Its triangular shape gives it its name and distinct identity among Maharashtra’s hill forts.

details.label: Location
details.value: Kamshet, near Lonavala, Pune District, Maharashtra

climate.description: The fort enjoys a cool and refreshing climate most of the year. The monsoon season brings misty trails and lush greenery, making it ideal for trekkers.

seasons.text: Monsoon (June–September): Best time for scenic treks and nature photography.
Winter (November–February): Pleasant weather for trekking and exploring ruins.

geography.conclusion: Tikona Fort offers a perfect mix of adventure and history — ideal for trekkers, photographers, and history lovers seeking a short getaway near Lonavala.

activities.title: Trekking Adventure
activities.description: A moderate-level trek with stone steps and scenic plateaus offering panoramic Sahyadri views.

activities.title: Photography & Nature
activities.description: Capture breathtaking views of Pawna Lake and the mist-covered peaks during monsoon.
info: Best spots: Top of the fort, watchtower area, lake view points
Ideal time: Early morning or post-monsoon

activities.title: Historic Exploration
activities.description: Explore the remnants of old gates, water tanks, a small temple, and watchtowers that tell the story of Maratha architecture.
info: Main sites: Trimbakeshwar Mahadev Temple, fort bastions, old caves
Time needed: 2–3 hours for complete exploration

attractions.title: Pawna Lake
attractions.description: A serene lake popular for camping and boating, offering stunning views from Tikona Fort.

attractions.title: Tung Fort
attractions.description: Another beautiful hill fort across Pawna Lake, often visited together with Tikona.

marineLife.intro: Although Tikona is a hill fort, its surrounding valleys and Pawna Lake nurture rich biodiversity and scenic beauty.

items.title: Flora
items.description: Dense green vegetation, wildflowers, and unique monsoon plants along the trek.

items.title: Fauna
items.description: Local bird species like bulbuls, drongos, and eagles can often be seen gliding over the valleys.

conclusion: Tikona Fort offers a peaceful connection with nature through its lush greenery and clean air.
Perfect for eco-tourism enthusiasts and trekkers alike.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Regular trains from Pune and Lonavala

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Distance from Pune: 60 km via Paud Road
Accessible by car till Tikona Peth village

gallery.alt: Pawna Lake view from Tikona Fort

bookingTips.description: Start your trek early morning to avoid afternoon heat and crowd.
Carry rainwear and non-slip shoes during monsoon season.
Bring enough drinking water and light snacks; limited facilities available near the base village.
